description: After the 1 Nov. update, the application no longer runs. Please fix it. Otherwise, it's a great app.
Pretty vague ...
So far its been the best RSS reader. Lacks few useful options though
tas de bugs, fonctionnalité non aboutie, il manque également des fontions de base comme la rcherche de contenu sur le net

Crashes while rearranging some of the default example feeds. Doesn't remember the view layout correctly. Resizing window can completely hide the preview pane, doesn't scale proportionately. Favicons are fixed to a massive size which obviously looks bad since most websites provide small favicons. Doesn't have a reader view. No font options.
Liferea is quick, adds subscriptions easily with a minimal amount of clicks , and even does embedded audo for podcasts. You have to give it a try.
summary: The best RSS reader on Ubuntu

description: It immediately crashes after viewing a link to a feed. Insta-uninstall.
So much faster and smoother than other versions I tried. I really like this app.

Imports OPML podcast subscriptions, like many RSS readers. But unlike any of the RSS readers, it can play the podcast in the window. The layout is OK. I prefer the clean look/feel to other ones like, say, Feedreader. But the functionality of Liferea is awesome. I sort of prefer Newsboat or Fraidycat for following blogs. But Liferea is my go-to for podcasts. Gpodder gets painfully slow with too many subscriptions, and I have had mixed results with Cpod working at all. Liferea provides lots of funcitonality and really delivers as a useful utility that gets out of my way and just works.
summary: Good for podcasts too - OPML import and play

description: It's up to dated for all eyes to know what's going on
summary: it's every thing you need for today's news

description:
The flatpak version runs still on GNOME 42, which is end-of-life, hence unsupported. The command sudo flatpak upgrade results in:

Looking for updates…
Info: org.gnome.Platform//42 is end-of-life, with reason:
  The GNOME 42 runtime is no longer supported as of March 21, 2023. Please ask your application developer to migrate to a supported platform.
Applications using this runtime:
  net.sourceforge.liferea

What seems to be the problem. I couldn't find any issues reported on source repository.

A nice, lightweight feed reader for Linux that does the basics: lets you subscribe to RSS and Atom feeds and read the new posts when you feel like it. Does its job, doesn't hog resources, and stays out of the way.

Downsides: Doesn't sync your subscriptions and read/unread status with anything.
summary: A nice, lightweight feed reader that does the basics

description: Good Software, use it daily now
Das Programm stellt keine Verbindung zu InoReader her. Eine Anpassung der Verbindungseinstellungen ist nicht möglich.
Ordner erstellen funktioniert nicht mehr bei mir !!
Pas besoin de compte en ligne
interface adaptable, bien pensée

There is no socks5 (tor) option so no privacy. It is easy to implement, but I believe it is deliberate. I chose Quiterss because even though it is not as pleasant to the eye, it has this privacy option.
Отлично работает с RSS
Просто СУПЕР!!
